references.paper_title: Linear matrix inequalities in system and control theory
references.reason: This seminal work provides the foundational theory for linear matrix inequalities (LMIs), which are central to semidefinite programming (SDP) and widely used in control theory and optimization.

This paper provides a comprehensive overview of semidefinite programming (SDP), including its applications and theoretical properties, which are essential to understanding the methods described in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Augmented Lagrangians and applications of the proximal point algorithm in convex programming
references.reason: This paper establishes the fundamental connection between augmented Lagrangian methods (ALMs) and proximal point methods (PPMs), providing the theoretical basis for the ALM analysis in the current paper.

references.paper_title: On the R-superlinear convergence of the KKT residuals generated by the augmented Lagrangian method for convex composite conic programming
references.reason: This work establishes the R-superlinear convergence of KKT residuals for ALMs applied to convex composite conic programs, which provides a foundation for analyzing the convergence rates of ALMs in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Error bounds, quadratic growth, and linear convergence of proximal methods
references.reason: This paper establishes the relationship between error bounds, quadratic growth, and linear convergence of proximal methods, which provides a key theoretical tool for analyzing the convergence behavior of ALMs in the current paper.
